Class Component

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlienAddons, HotWaterHeater, HousingUnit, PlasmaDrill, PowerCenter, SewerPipes, ShieldGenerator, SpaceVoid, Storage
public abstract class Component extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract base class representing a component in the game. Components are designed to be extended by specific component types and can represent various functionalities in the game such as utilities, housing, storage, and other elements. This class provides common methods and properties that all components inherit, while allowing extending classes to define specific functionality. Serialization with JSON is supported, and different subtypes can be identified through the "componentType" property for proper deserialization. Subclasses must implement methods for rotation, validation, insertion, removal, and cloning. Additionally, components can accept specific actions via the visitor pattern. The class integrates with `PlayerBoard` and uses a `Tile` object to represent the position of the component.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component()
      Default constructor for the Component class. This initializes a new Component object. As an abstract class, Component is intended to be extended by various specific implementations to represent distinct elements within the game. This constructor provides base setup needed for component instances. The Component class integrates with a tile-based system and can interact with a PlayerBoard. Subclasses are required to implement and extend specific functionalities.

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public abstract void rotate(Boolean direction)
      Rotates the component in the specified direction. The rotation may alter the orientation of the component within the game.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the rotation. If true, the component rotates clockwise; if false, it rotates counterclockwise.

    • controlValidity

      public abstract boolean controlValidity(PlayerBoard pb, int x, int y)
      Validates whether a specific tile position on the player's board is valid for the component to be placed. The method determines if the provided coordinates are appropriate and adhere to game rules or constraints.
      Parameters:
      pb - The player's board where the validity of the position will be checked.
      x - The x-coordinate of the tile to validate.
      y - The y-coordinate of the tile to validate.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the position at (x, y) on the player's board is valid (true) or not (false).

    • insert

      public abstract void insert(PlayerBoard playerBoard, int x, int y)
      Inserts the component into the player's board at the specified coordinates. Subclasses should implement the specific behavior for insertion, ensuring that the component is placed and associated correctly within the player board system.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board where the component is being inserted
      x - the x-coordinate on the player's board where the component will be placed
      y - the y-coordinate on the player's board where the component will be placed

    • remove

      public abstract void remove(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Removes the current component from the specified player board. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the behavior of removal, such as updating the game state or removing references to the component.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player board from which the component should be removed

    • getType

      public int getType()
      Retrieves the type of the component. The type is represented as an integer and provides identification for different component subtypes in the game.
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the component's type

    • setType

      public void setType(int type)
      Sets the type of the component.
      Parameters:
      type - an integer representing the type of the component

    • accept

      public void accept(ComponentAction visitor, PlayerState state)
      Accepts a visitor implementing the ComponentAction interface and performs actions or validations based on the provided game state. The visitor pattern allows dynamic dispatch of specific actions based on the type of the component and its interaction logic. This method throws an InvalidInput exception by default to indicate that the specific action is not valid or supported for the current component.
      Parameters:
      visitor - the visitor implementing the ComponentAction interface, representing an action or operation to be performed on the component
      state - the game state of the player, providing context for validating the action or determining its impact
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - when the action represented by the visitor is not valid for the specific component or player state

    • clone

      public abstract Component clone(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Creates and returns a deep copy of the current component associated with the given player board. The cloned component maintains its state while being independent of the original instance.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board associated with the cloned component
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the current component

    • setTile

      public void setTile(Tile tile)
      Sets the Tile object associated with this component. This method assigns a specific Tile to the component, defining its positional and contextual relationship within the game. The Tile represents the location and configuration where the component resides on the board.
      Parameters:
      tile - the Tile to associate with this component
